docs.abstract: Mr. Sanders’s total is the largest three-month haul disclosed by any candidate so far in the Democratic primary race.
docs.snippet: Mr. Sanders’s total is the largest three-month haul disclosed by any candidate so far in the Democratic primary race.
docs.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont raised more than $34.5 million in the fourth quarter of 2019, his presidential campaign said Thursday, yet another display of his enduring financial might fueled by a huge base of grass-roots donors.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders Raised $34.5 Million in the Fourth Quarter, Pacing the Field

byline.original: By Sydney Ember and Thomas Kaplan

docs.abstract: Amy Klobuchar remains in a distant fifth place in Iowa, where her biggest challenge is translating rising curiosity around her candidacy into support on caucus night.
docs.snippet: Amy Klobuchar remains in a distant fifth place in Iowa, where her biggest challenge is translating rising curiosity around her candidacy into support on caucus night.
docs.lead_paragraph: DIAGONAL, Iowa — Amy Klobuchar was holding two loaves of bread.

headline.main: Klobuchar Is Banking on Iowa Moderates. Her Problem: So Is Buttigieg.
headline.print_headline: Interest Grows, but Klobuchar Still Has Tall Ladder to Climb in Iowa

docs.abstract: In Iowa, Democratic candidates sought to undercut President Trump’s core message of a strong economy by making the case that it isn’t working for the right people.
docs.snippet: In Iowa, Democratic candidates sought to undercut President Trump’s core message of a strong economy by making the case that it isn’t working for the right people.
docs.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — On paper, Esther Mabior should be fine. She has a degree from Iowa State University, where she majored in economics, and lives in a city where her chosen profession, the insurance business, employs thousands of people.

headline.main: As Trump Hails Stock Market, Democrats Point to Struggling Workers
headline.print_headline: Beneath Economic Gloss, 2020 Democrats See a Struggling Working Class

byline.original: By Jeremy W. Peters and Sydney Ember

docs.abstract: House Democrats in key swing districts hope the debate over rising costs will give them a decisive advantage next year, especially in suburbs where President Trump remains unpopular.
docs.snippet: House Democrats in key swing districts hope the debate over rising costs will give them a decisive advantage next year, especially in suburbs where President Trump remains unpopular.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The high costs of health care are a driving force animating House Democrats in the swing districts that will decide control of Congress next year, with the electoral consequences of their votes to impeach President Trump unclear and a court ruling that left the fate of the Affordable Care Act in limbo.

headline.main: Democrats Who Flipped Seats in 2018 Have a 2020 Playbook: Focus on Drug Costs
headline.print_headline: 2020 Priority for First-Term Democrats: Lower Drug Costs

docs.abstract: President Trump, who has been gripped by anxiety about evangelical voters abandoning him, took wide swipes at Democratic rivals one day after the strike on a top Iranian leader.
docs.snippet: President Trump, who has been gripped by anxiety about evangelical voters abandoning him, took wide swipes at Democratic rivals one day after the strike on a top Iranian leader.
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — In his first public appearance since the strike that killed Maj. Gen. Qassim Suleimani of Iran, President Trump rallied his evangelical Christian base of supporters on Friday, portraying himself as the restorer of faith in the public square and claiming that God is “on our side.”

headline.main: In Miami Speech, Trump Tells Evangelical Base: God Is ‘on Our Side’
headline.print_headline: Trump Tells Evangelical Base: God Is ‘on Our Side’

byline.original: By Jennifer Medina and Maggie Haberman

docs.abstract: It has been over a month since any relevant state-level poll was conducted. So if candidates like Cory Booker or Tulsi Gabbard have made gains in early-voting states, there’s no polling to show it.

headline.main: Polls Set the Debate Lineup. But There Aren’t Many State Polls to Go On.

docs.abstract: After garnering 19 percent support in a national poll, the billionaire will be on the debate stage, where he is certain to be a target of onstage criticism.
docs.snippet: After garnering 19 percent support in a national poll, the billionaire will be on the debate stage, where he is certain to be a target of onstage criticism.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Former Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg of New York has qualified for the next two Democratic debates, including one on Wednesday in Las Vegas. It will be his first appearance onstage alongside his presidential rivals.

headline.main: Michael Bloomberg Surges in Polls and Qualifies for 2 Democratic Debates
headline.print_headline: Bloomberg Surges in Polls And Qualifies for Debates

byline.original: By Reid J. Epstein and Maggie Astor

docs.abstract: The feud between Amy Klobuchar and Pete Buttigieg erupted onstage in Las Vegas over her failure to remember the name of Mexico’s leader. Elizabeth Warren came to Ms. Klobuchar’s defense.
docs.snippet: The feud between Amy Klobuchar and Pete Buttigieg erupted onstage in Las Vegas over her failure to remember the name of Mexico’s leader. Elizabeth Warren came to Ms. Klobuchar’s defense.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — The simmering Midwestern feud between Senator Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota and Pete Buttigieg erupted on Wednesday night, as the two rivals increasingly turned their cannons on each other in a manner that was by turns caustic and personal.

headline.main: Klobuchar and Buttigieg Spar Over Her Stumble on Mexico’s President
